content: yarn doc olive oil scarf pattern design this pattern was inspired by the olive producing region of the istrian peninsula in croatia and the colours of the italy yarn used in the sample the stitch pattern chosen has subtle nods to the traditional oil making process while i have made several samples of this pattern and tested the math repeatedly it has not been through a formal pattern test it does however come with a full youtube tutorial https //youtu be/pqxpjks1nkw a chart two dijerent border options and a written pattern terminology us terminology is used in this pattern yarn this scarf is made to measure so you can use any weight of yarn you choose the yarn used in the sample was filati tre sfere maia 20% llama and 80% acrylic it comes in 50 grams skeins with 200 meters per skein the full pattern with olive border required just under 2 skeins hook i recommend using the hook size recommended for the yarn you choose or increasing by one size in order to get nice drape for the sample i used a 6mm in-line hook for my chain and a 4mm in-line hook for the rest of the scarf gauge since this pattern is made to measure you do not need to meet gauge in order to complete this pattern © yarn doc ellen white 1 pattern chart without border row written pattern starting chain using a hook size larger than you will use for the rest of the pattern chain multiples of 4+1 e g the chart above is 4x6+1 for a total of 25 stitches until you reach the length you desire for your scarf if you prefer to a single_crochet starting chain you can do this by combining this step with the first row row 1 single_crochet into back bump of each chain ensure that you have a multiple of 4+1 row 2 single_crochet into first stitch - if you chain 1 to go up do not count it as a stitch chain 5 skip 3 single_crochet * © yarn doc ellen white 2 row 3 double_crochet dv-st 2dc chain 2dc into center of the chain space or 3rd chain * double_crochet option 2 single_crochet into 3rd chain row 4 single_crochet ch2 single_crochet into chain of dv-st ch5 single_crochet into chain of dv-st * ch2 single_crochet into final st © yarn doc ellen white 3 row 5 double_crochet chain 5 5dctog option 2 goes into 3rd chain rather than chain space * chain 5 double_crochet in final st option 2 single_crochet into 3rd chain row 6 single_crochet ch5 single_crochet into top of 5dctog * chain 5 single_crochet row 7 repeat row 3 row 8 repeat row 4 row 9 repeat row 5 row 10 repeat row 6 row 11 repeat row 3 © yarn doc ellen white 4 row 12 single_crochet chain single_crochet into chain of dv-st ch3 single_crochet into chain of dv-st * ch1 single_crochet row 13 single_crochet into every st including chain around
